docs.title: Server

toc.content: What is the purpose of servers?

docs.excerpt:
What is a server?

A server represents a messaging broker system where connections and communication between a producer and a consumer are established. Unlike traditional API servers which are depende

docs.title: Producer
docs.excerpt:
What is a Producer?

A producer is an application that senses state changes (events) and publishes those events as messages. An event indicates a state change or update triggered by a user's/device's

docs.title: Consumer
docs.excerpt:
What is a consumer?

In an Event Driven Architecture (EDA), a consumer is an application that listens for a particular event from a broker and reacts to it.

Why do we need consumers?

Unlike traditio

docs.title: Channel
docs.excerpt:
What is a channel?

A channel is a mechanism created by the server for the organization and transmission of messages. Users can define channels as a topic, queue, routing key, path,  or subject depend

docs.title: Application
docs.excerpt:
What is an application?

An application is any computer program or a group of them. 

An application could also be a micro-service, IoT device (sensor), mainframe process, etc. Users may even write ap

docs.title: Protocol
docs.excerpt:
What is a protocol?

A protocol is a set of rules that specifies how information is exchanged between applications and/or servers.

Protocol examples:

WebSockets
HTTP
Kafka
MQTT

Why do we need proto

docs.title: Message
docs.excerpt:
What is a message?

A message is a communication asset used to transmit or exchange information from a sender to the receiver through channels. A single message can be consumed by multiple independent

AsyncAPI CLI

Generator CLI
Generator library

Generator CLI

- <asyncapi>: Local path or URL point

Template

A template is a project that specifies the generation process output by using the AsyncAPI generator and an AsyncAPI document. These files describe the generation results depending on the As

Parser

The AsyncAPI Parser is a package used to parse and validate the AsyncAPI documents in your Node.js or browser application. These documents can be either in YAML or JSON format.

docs.title: Nunjucks render engine

Nunjucks is the default render engine, however, we strongly recommend adopting the React engine.

Common assumptions

Templates may contain Nunjucks filters or helper functions. Read more about filter

blog.title: AsyncAPI Spec 2.1.0 Release Notes
blog.excerpt: The eagle has landed! Check out all the changes the AsyncAPI specification introduces in the new v2.1.0 release

toc.content: Message examples object extended with additional fields
Custom schema formats mandatory vs recommended
Old new defaultContentType property in root object

blog.title: AsyncAPI Spec 2.2.0 Release Notes
blog.excerpt: 2.2 release of AsyncAPI specification is here. The long-awaited feature for assigning channels to servers is finally here.

blog.title: AsyncAPI Spec 2.3.0 Release Notes
blog.excerpt: AsyncAPI 2.3 is now released. This brings enhancements allowing new ways of structuring AsyncAPI documents and support for describing Solace APIs.

toc.content: Servers and channels can now be defined as reusable components

blog.title: AsyncAPI Spec 2.4.0 Release Notes
blog.excerpt: AsyncAPI 2.4 is now released. This brings really helpful additions, such as the new `messageId` field, Server Variables reusability, and security at Operation level

toc.content: Message uniqueness thanks to the new messageId field
Server Variables can be now referenced from components
Security can now be defined at Operation level
Reusability of Servers defined in Components is clarified in the specification

blog.title: AsyncAPI Spec 2.5.0 Release Notes

authors.name: Vladimír Gorej
authors.byline: Open Source Software Engineer, OSS contributor, author and content creator.

blog.excerpt: The release of AsyncAPI 2.5 brings helpful additions, such as extended Server Variables reusability and many clarifications.

toc.content: Server Variables can be now referenced from inside the Server Object
Added missing IBM MQ Operation Binding
Added new Google Cloud Pub/Sub Bindings

item.title: Overview

toc.content: Concepts: Define AsyncAPI features and capabilities

item.excerpt:
Concepts: Define AsyncAPI features and capabilities

Welcome to AsyncAPI Concepts! Our Concepts section will define the concepts of AsyncAPI features and capabilities.

Contribute to AsyncAPI Concepts

item.title: Server

toc.content: What is the purpose of servers?

item.excerpt:
What is a server?

A server represents a messaging broker system where connections and communication between a producer and a consumer are established. Unlike traditional API servers which are depende

item.title: Producer
item.excerpt:
What is a Producer?

A producer is an application that senses state changes (events) and publishes those events as messages. An event indicates a state change or update triggered by a user's/device's

item.title: Consumer
item.excerpt:
What is a consumer?

In an Event Driven Architecture (EDA), a consumer is an application that listens for a particular event from a broker and reacts to it.

Why do we need consumers?

Unlike traditio

item.title: Channel
item.excerpt:
What is a channel?

A channel is a mechanism created by the server for the organization and transmission of messages. Users can define channels as a topic, queue, routing key, path,  or subject depend

item.title: Application
item.excerpt:
What is an application?

An application is any computer program or a group of them. 

An application could also be a micro-service, IoT device (sensor), mainframe process, etc. Users may even write ap

item.title: Protocol
item.excerpt:
What is a protocol?

A protocol is a set of rules that specifies how information is exchanged between applications and/or servers.

Protocol examples:

WebSockets
HTTP
Kafka
MQTT

Why do we need proto

item.title: Message
item.excerpt:
What is a message?

A message is a communication asset used to transmit or exchange information from a sender to the receiver through channels. A single message can be consumed by multiple independent

The format of the file must be JSON or YAML; however, only the subset of YAML that m

Some examples of these are:

User & password
Certificates
API keys
OAuth 2

children.title: Introduction
children.excerpt: The AsyncAPI generator is a tool that generates anything you want using the AsyncAPI Document and Template that are supplied as inputs to the AsyncAPI CLI. The generator was built with extensibility i

children.title: Installation guide
children.excerpt:
You can use the generator library to generate whatever you want in your event-driven architecture apps. Find your preferred method below:

AsyncAPI CLI
Generator library in Node.js apps

Prerequisites

children.title: Usage
children.excerpt:
There are two ways to use the generator:

Generator CLI
Generator library

Generator CLI

Usage: asyncapi generate fromTemplate <asyncapi> <template> [<options>]

- <asyncapi>: Local path or URL point

children.title: AsyncAPI document
children.excerpt: The AsyncAPI document defines a standard, protocol-agnostic interface that describes message-based or event-driven APIs. The AsyncAPI document allows people or machines communicating with one another,

children.title: Template
children.excerpt:
Template

A template is a project that specifies the generation process output by using the AsyncAPI generator and an AsyncAPI document. These files describe the generation results depending on the As

children.title: Parser
children.excerpt:
Parser

The AsyncAPI Parser is a package used to parse and validate the AsyncAPI documents in your Node.js or browser application. These documents can be either in YAML or JSON format.

The Parser val

children.title: Generator version vs template version

Generator

Generatornew Generator(templateName, targetDir, options)

You can also check Template for Generator Templates project to see s

Name Type Description
renderer String Its value can be either react or nunjucks (defa

children.title: Template context
children.excerpt:
While using the generator tool, you may want dynamic values populated to your templates and rendered in the output. The generator can achieve that using the template context.
The template context allo

children.title: React render engine
children.excerpt:
React is the render engine that we strongly suggest you should use for any new templates. The only reason it is not the default render engine is to stay backward compatible.

It enables the possibilit

children.title: Nunjucks render engine
children.excerpt:
Nunjucks is the default render engine, however, we strongly recommend adopting the React engine.

Common assumptions

Templates may contain Nunjucks filters or helper functions. Read more about filter

children.title: Hooks
children.excerpt: Hooks are functions called by the generator on a specific moment in the generation process. Hooks can be anonymous functions but you can also add function names. These hooks can have arguments provide

children.title: File templates
children.excerpt: It is possible to generate files for each specific object in your AsyncAPI documentation. For example, you can specify a filename like $$channel$$.js to generate a file for each channel defined in you

children.title: TypeScript support
children.excerpt:
The AsyncAPI generator has TypeScript support for hooks and Nunjucks's filters. Assumptions:

Installing the typescript package and creating the tsconfig.json file isn't necessary.
